item.title: Report E-2024020370
item.description:
Report E-2024020370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (2) punctured bags containing Sodium Sulfide, Hydrated that released approximately 1-cup of product onto the wooden trailer floor. The punctured occurred because of a pallet jack. A Contractor cleaned-up the spill and containerized the damaged bags and shrink wrap in (1) 55DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024021011
item.description:
Report X-2024021011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA placed the bucket in black tub for hazmat when they realized the it was leaking. DescribePack: At first glance the bucket looks like it is in good condition until I saw a small puddle forming at the bottom. When examining the bucket, it was then when I realized it has a small hole near the bottom. The bucket will still slowly leak out the hazardous material while stand up correctly. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a black tub until I came around to place it in yellow drum.

item.title: Report E-2024020344
item.description:
Report E-2024020344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2929 was damaged due to unknown reasons and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed the released material evaporated from the loading dock floor prior to their arrival. E3 personnel placed the damaged 5-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for further evaluation.

item.title: Report X-2024020894
item.description:
Report X-2024020894

  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: sequence of events are unknown. Hazmat team was called to come and remove package from dock area. DescribePack: The plastic pail is busted almost half way around the circumference of the bottom of the pail. As a result, the chlorine granules began to spill out of container into the bottom of the box and eventually outside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazbag and put into a hazardous tote and brought to the HMPA for further examination.

item.title: Report X-2024020866
item.description:
Report X-2024020866

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found leaking during preload. Pkg may have not been facing with orientation arrows upwards The area was temporarily evacuated and absorbent mats was used to clean up the spill. At discovery, the pkg was immediately taken to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Leaking from top of can. No clips seen. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were told what to do when a hazmat leaks. They were retaught how to properly load hazmats with orientation arrows upwards. Absorbent mats were used for cleanup.

item.title: Report X-2024021039
item.description:
Report X-2024021039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It appears tape failed on the bottom of packaging. While unloading the package bottom opened up causing inner contents fall out. (1) plastic Gallon bottle of Lime-B-Gone landed with cap side down causing it to crack and spill some contents. QA was notified and removed package to Hazmat cage utilizing all appropriate PPE to include, Gloves, goggles and face mask. DescribePack: Tape on the bottom of the package gave way under the weight of items causing one of the bottles to fall on the cap causing it to crack DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was immediately picked up and placed upright to minimize amount of spillage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PH were unloading trailer when they discovered a hazmat that appeared to be very wet. PH called out for a damaged hazmat and QA took the package to hazmat cage for inspection. Upon QA inspection it was discovered that the caps to 2 of the gallons of menthol were loose and had caused a leakage of 1.5 Gallons. DescribePack: Loose caps. Leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazardous waste only bin and removed from unload to hazmat cage for inspection.

This was reported to management. spilled contents swept up and placed in plastic Hazmat bag and tote for containment. DescribePack: there is a large crack at the upper portion on the plastic pale. It is about 3inches in length.1 DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in hazmat bag and tote

item.title: Report I-2023120011
item.description:
Report I-2023120011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0900 on 11/30/23 it was noted that the car in question was leaking down both sides of the car from under the dome lid, the car owner was notified and sent representitives from Haz Mate Special Services to inspect, they discovered that the car was leaking due to a defective gasket between on the liquid line in between the pressure plate and the valve flange. This gasket was changed out and the car was pressure tested by Eagle Car.

item.title: Report I-2023110073
item.description:
Report I-2023110073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: BROWNSVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COASTAL TRANSPORT CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The cargo tank motor vehicle was loaded with 9700 gallons of gasoline. The driver attempted to make a 90 degree turn to the left from one roadway to another at an intersection. The vehicle's speed was too fast for conditions. The liquid load surged to the passenger side of the vehicle. The sudden weight shift to the right side caused the unit to roll over onto its right (passenger) side. The vehicle came to rest partially on the pavement and the grassy shoulder on the right side of the roadway. The driver exited from the tractor cab by crawling through the windshield frame opening. As the vehicle was lying on its right side, the liquid level rose above the manhole/venting fixtures. Gasoline began seeping through the venting fixture. The local fire department and HM response personnel placed absorbent materials around the unit. HM response personnel performed a "cold tap" drilling procedure on the side of the semi-trailer. A suction hose and pump was used to transfer product from the overturned unit into a recovery cargo tank motor vehicle. After off loading was completed, product measurements revealed approximately 450 gallons of gasoline had leaked through the venting fixture. The leaked product found its way to the ground surface alongside the pavement. Lone Star HazMat response is handing the removal and replacement of any contaminated earth alongside of the pavement.

item.title: Report I-2023120013
item.description:
Report I-2023120013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CONDUCTING A SWEEP OF THE UNLOAD DOORS, WHEN HE NOTICED A PACKAGE ON THE GRADING. PACKAGE SHOWED STAINS OF LEAKAGE, WITH FULL PPE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE APPORIATE RESPONSE SHEET (NO LABEL ON BOX OR UNKNOWN, UNDECLARED). THEN BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
